comments.content:
Ooh, some really nice ones, this time..   
   
I especially like 24.004, 24.007 and hmm,   
it seems i somehow looove 24.008.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518122856im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
( The handdrawn one.. )

i also really like the letraset one..   
   
24.009 really looks like .. a giant crucifix.. i'm not sure if i'm about that..

What does the small text on 012 say?   
   
hhp

007 is cool! but i�don�t understand   
009 the concept is interesting but who wear it?

I'd wear 24.005 - good ol subtlety...quiet confidence and style   
   
on another topic: whats with this naming-the contest-on-the-actual-shirt-thing that keeps happening. that's just bizarr to be wearing a t-shirt that says the t-shirt was part of a competition.   
   
the fact that this is a contest should have nothing to do with the design. imagine Christian Dior starting labelling couture with graphics front and center stating its part of the "fall collection"   
   
or a poster that said "poster" under the topical issue title of the poster.
I like 012 -- it's got that old-time Type ID Pop Quiz flavor!
008 is really nice, but I see the Funny Garbage logo.
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518122856im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/17082.gif)

Now I like 012 a lot.   
   
hhp
I'd like it even better if the key were on the back. It's provocative and more elegant without the key on the front.

Chesh, good idea. At the _bottom_ of the back, that way you could bend over\* and have people read it without having to go totally upside down - good human interface design!   
   
\* Don't go there...   
   
hhp
When do we get to start guessing which design is whose?

Now.   
   
hhp

The Letraset one is cool but how many people remember Letraset. I'm old enough to but how about a 20 something year old. I have heard statistics that make me shake my head in terms of kids not knowing history. Like some kids never knew a time before the internet. Dan

12 is gorgeous. Easily my favorite so far. I do really like the idea of having the key on the back though. Would make the shirt perfect imo.   
   
-dh
...i'm turning 21 in a month and i know about Letraset.. i remember its presence in my childhood.. [thanks to my father]

12 is very nice but it feels off balance. The first three letters are cropped almost identically, and the last four identically, with the o kind of in between. This was probably done on purpose but I don't like all the white space at the beginning. If they were recropped more randomly.. I think it would probably be my favorite so far.

i agree with Bryan that this difference   
of white space creates a restless tention,   
though i guess the designer wanted   
to separate the two synthetic words   
of typophile.   
   
So, this restless has a cause   
and i would "forgive" it. I also believe   
that 012 is the winner of the tees above.
Very nice the 24.012, one of my favourits until now.
